page.title: 01Rural Area SW Of St. Austell
page.content: Essentially a rural area, the region lies to the SW of St. Austell which serves as its shopping and employment centre. There are two sizeable villages, Polgooth and sticker, several hamlets and scattered farmsteads. The villages are a mixture of very old cottages and modern houses or bungalows. The undulating farmland is largely devoted to pasture for feeding livestock. Hay and beet are also grown for this purpose. The livestock consists mainly of Fresian cows, for both milk and beef, and sheep. A few fields are sown with dredg corn, potatoes and greens or broccoli. There is also a small deciduous wood of mature trees, not commercially productive. The A390 traverses the northern section of the region but the remainder is served by narrow, winding lanes.
